intro: Dipladenia williamsii, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often woody and thorny. Dipladenia williamsii is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
